title: 112_hr6182
content: The Act titled "American Advanced Energy Manufacturing Jobs Act of 2012" extends and expands the qualifying advanced energy project credit. The Act titled "American Advanced Energy Manufacturing Jobs Act of 2012" extends and expands the qualifying advanced energy project credit by amending section 48C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a 30 percent credit for the basis of statutory advanced energy property placed in service and a 30 percent credit for qualified investment in qualifying advanced energy projects. The term 'statutory advanced energy property' refers to eligible property used exclusively for manufacturing equipment that uses solar energy, fuel cell power plants, or systems for electro-chemical storage of electricity. This term does not include any property after December 31, 2016. The extension and modification of the Qualifying Advanced Energy Project Program includes a limitation on the total amount of qualified investments that can be designated under the program. This limitation ensures that the total amount of credits allowed under the program is not exceeded. Additionally, statutory advanced energy property cannot be considered when determining the qualified investment in any qualifying advanced energy project. The Qualifying Advanced Energy Project Program has a total amount of credits allowed, with specific limitation amounts for 2009 and 2012. Manufacturing of property used for composite utility poles is also included, with requirements for recycled materials. The Qualifying Advanced Energy Project Program gives preference to projects using recycled materials and fully recyclable components. Projects that only assemble components are given the lowest priority. There are limitations on the amount of qualified investment for qualifying advanced manufacturing projects. The Qualifying Advanced Energy Project Program prioritizes projects using recycled materials and fully recyclable components, with limitations on qualified investment for advanced manufacturing projects. Amendments to the tax code specify requirements for qualifying projects. Amendments to the tax code include a 1-year limitation period, periodic review, and redistribution by the Secretary, and an amendment to clause (v) of section 49(a)(1)(C) regarding statutory advanced energy property. The amendments made by this section apply to periods after the enactment of this Act, similar to the rules of section 48(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. MODIFICATIONS OF FOREIGN TAX CREDIT RULES FOR MAJOR INTEGRATED OIL COMPANIES. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include special rules for major integrated oil companies that are dual capacity taxpayers. Any amount paid to a foreign country or possession of the United States by such taxpayers will not be considered a tax under certain conditions. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes special rules for major integrated oil companies that are dual capacity taxpayers. These taxpayers pay income tax to a foreign country or possession of the United States, which is not considered a tax under certain conditions. Dual capacity taxpayer refers to a person who meets specific criteria in relation to a foreign country or possession of the United States. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has special rules for major integrated oil companies that are dual capacity taxpayers. A dual capacity taxpayer is someone subject to a levy of a foreign country or possession of the United States and receives a specific economic benefit from that country. The term "generally applicable income tax" refers to income taxes generally imposed by a foreign country on income from a trade or business conducted within that country. The amendments made by this section apply to taxes paid in taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act, except where contrary to any US treaty obligations. SEC. 4. LIMITATION ON DEDUCTION FOR INTANGIBLE DRILLING AND DEVELOPMENT COSTS OF MAJOR INTEGRATED OIL COMPANIES. This subsection limits deductions for major integrated oil companies for amounts paid or incurred in taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act.
